alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 3:10PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Phillips, Petroleum and southwestern Garfield Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 309 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Crooked Creek Rec Area, or 23 miles northeast of Winnett, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winnett, Sand Springs, U L Bend Rec Area, Crooked Creek Rec Area, Petrolia Lake, Cat Creek and Tiegen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
